result.execSummary:
The defendant Kaylynn N Berg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Court orders bond on file to be applied-Costs are paid in full.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is to have NO CONTACT with Damian Johnston and/or Amanda Behling.
Upon successful completion of probation term, Defendant may petition the Court for expungement pursuant to s. 973.015.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kaylynn N Berg

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 9:50 am cases called-16CM69 & 16CM124. Defendant Kaylynn N Berg in court with attorney Paul Edward Zilles.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on record by ADA Anderson.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1 of 16CM69.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Court dismisses and read-in Count 2 & 16CM124. Sentencing statement by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Attorney Zilles. Court sentences the defendant to: Impose 4 months WCJ, STAYED and places on probation for a period of 12 months. If revoked, with Huber and Good Time Credit. Credit for 2 days served. CONDITIONS: AODA & follow through,   Maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No Contact with Damian Johnston and/or Amanda Behling. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Court orders bond on file to be applied. Court will grant petition for expungement upon successful completion of probation and conditions. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Court grants defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 26, 2016 at 09:45 am.
Status conference on April 20, 2016 at 02:10 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Defendant Kaylynn N Berg in court with attorney Paul Edward Zilles.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  NGP received and entered.   Cash Bond ordered w/conditions.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 02:10 pm.
